snippet: Relatives and associates gave differing accounts of the mental state and history of Miriam Carey, who was killed after trying to drive into the White House complex.
abstract: Law enforcement authorities are still trying to understand what prompted Miriam Carey, who was shot down by police after high-speed chase, to force her car onto White House grounds; questions are also being raised about whether she posed enough of a threat during fast-moving sequence of events that the police needed to shoot her.

byline.original: By N. R. KLEINFIELD and WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Kristin Hussey, Marc Santora, Michael S. Schmidt, Nate Schweber, Michael D. Shear and Vivian Yee, and research by Susan Beachy.

lead_paragraph: Relatives and associates gave differing accounts of the mental state and history of Miriam Carey, who was killed after trying to drive into the White House complex.

headline.seo: Miriam Carey Was in Car When Police Fired, Official Says
headline.main: Possible Clues in Fatal Chase, but No Motive
headline.print_headline: Possible Clues In Fatal Chase, But No Motive
